Class Playground

  • java.lang.Object
    • Playground

  • class Playground
extends java.lang.Object
    Playground.java contains tictactoe game methods of printing playground, Player and AI moves, Setting playground size The class Tictactoe is authors projectwork of introduction to programming in Tampere Applied sciences of technology
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    2017.1211
    Author:
    Saku Tynjala

      • Playground

        Default Constructor

        uses setPGsize method

    • Method Detail

      • setPGsize

        void setPGsize()
        Set 2D array height and width.

        Ask user width and height. min 3 and max 50. Sets every spot in array "empty"(space)

      • getPG

        char[][] getPG()
        returns PG. not used.
        Returns:
        2D array of playground

      • printPG

        void printPG()
        Prints 2D array for player.

        prints cross-lines, vertical lines, column and row numbers to player easier to read game board.

      • winner

        java.lang.String winner()
        Returns string whowon in the end of game
        Returns:
        String of winner

      • checkspot

        boolean checkspot(int row,
                  int column)
        looks 2D array spot is it empty

        Looks array at given input values. Return boolean true if it's empty.

        Parameters:
        row - 2D array row number
        column - 2D array column number
        Returns:
        boolean true if spot is empty

      • checkwin

        boolean checkwin(boolean win)
        Checks is there 3 or 5 in row of marks

        goes through 2d array at every spot vertically, horizontally and diagonally down is there 3 or 5 in row to win. winlength depends on playground size. Return boolean true if game is won and sets String whowon to player or Ai who won.

        Parameters:
        win - takes in boolean value.
        Returns:
        boolean true if there is winner.

      • playerMove

        void playerMove()
        Asks player move

        determites player char place and uses checkspot method to check if that place is free to use. if player gives invalid number or input method will ask does player want to print playground for easier to check playground situation.

      • AImove

        void AImove()
        AI move.

        places Ai mark randomly in 2D arrays if spot is empty
